Description: Crawford and Company, an insurance services firm, agreed to pay the United States $1,363,204 to resolve allegations that between 1992 and 2002 it violated the False Claims Act when it submitted invoices to the federal government that contained inflated charges.

Company: Crawford Healthcare Management of Norfolk & Baltimore
Description: The company pleaded guilty to a one-count information charging that it engaged in a scheme to defraud its clients by overcharging them for the services performed by its employees.
